results.title: Doppler effect
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “College Physics”.
Explains the factors which determine the pitch of a sound. Waves are shown advancing toward the listener, and the following cases are treated: 1. Source and listener stationary; 2. Source in motion, listener stationary (accompanying change of wave-length and consequent change of apparent frequency are described in slow motion); 3. Source stationary, listener in motion (shows that no change in wave-length occurs, but that there is a change of apparent frequency).

results.title: The Carnot cycle and the Kelvin temperature scale
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “College Physics”.
The motion of a piston in a cylinder and a moving point on a pressure-volume diagram are used in explaining the four ideal processes which constitute the Carnot cycle. Shows heat being absorbed and rejected during the cycle and defines the Kelvin scale.

results.title: Testing infants (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cognitive Development”.
Aims to give a general picture of the development of infant abilities during the first eighteen months of life and to show how an experienced tester manages the test situation. Shows Dr. Aidan MacFarlane, a paediatrician, assessing the cognitive development of a number of infants aged from 3 to 19 months

results.title: Ways of studying children (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Chris Cuthbertson, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cognitive Development”.
Theories of child development go through phases with research leading to the formulation of new theories. The work of three psychologists is examined: first research on mother/child interaction, secondly styles of tutoring for pre-school children, and thirdly babies perception of containment.

group_siblings.title: A Year of change in three children (TEFC)

results.title: A Year of change in three children (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cognitive Development”.
It is not until 5 years old or so that children come to understand the notions of conservation of area, length and weight. This program, recorded at Nottingham primary school, examines the responses of three children to various Piagetian tests over a period of one year.

results.title: The Rocking horse winner
results.creator_credit: Peter Medak, William Deneen, Highgate Associates and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Classics Dark and Dangerous”.
Adapted from a novel by D.H. Lawrence about a young boy whose rocking horse empowers him to predict winning racehorses at the eventual cost of his life. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Silver Blaze
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Classics Dark and Dangerous”.
Called in to solve the baffling case involving the famous racehorse, Silver Blaze, Sherlock Holmes and Watson arrive at the small village of Tavistock to discover that the police have already arrested a suspect. However the detective uncovers discrepancies. He retraces the events of the night of the crime and ultimately comes to a surprising solution. Cast includes Christopher Plummer.
